definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: S. joint communiques and the fundamental norms governing international relations.
sentences.chinese: 它違背《中美三個聯合公報》和基本的國際關係準則。

sentences.english: The joint communiqué between the two countries was notified in the newspapers and over the radio.
sentences.chinese: 兩國發表的聯合公報已在各大報刊並以廣播形式公佈。

sentences.english: The two countries also released a joint communiqué.
sentences.chinese: 兩國還發表了聯合公報。

sentences.english: The three Sino-US Joint Communiques were signed in Shanghai in 1972.
sentences.chinese: 中美三個聯合公報於1972年在上海簽訂。

sentences.english: A joint communique of truce was issued on June 5 that year.
sentences.chinese: 一份休戰的聯合公報在那年6月5日發表。

sentences.english: The three joint communiqués serve as the political foundation of China-US relations.
sentences.chinese: 中美三個聯合公報是中美關係的政治基礎。

sentences.english: The two sides released a joint communique and signed several inter-governmental cooperation documents.
sentences.chinese: 雙方發表了聯合公報，簽署了多項政府間合作文件。

sentences.english: The two sides also issued a joint communique.
